faulty

Class Program

  • java.lang.Object
    • faulty.Program

  • public class Program
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines a FAULTY program, it provides the basic structures: a list of channels, separating in bool and int channels, and a factory to construct the BDD's correspondong to the program. The getBDD method is the way in which one may obtain the symbolic representation of the program.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBoolChannel(BoolChannel chan)
      Method to add a BoolChannel to the program
      void addBoolVar(VarBool var)
      Methof adding a global boolvar
      void addIntChannel(IntChannel chan)
      Method to add an IntChannel to the program
      void addIntVar(VarInt var)
      Method adding a global int var
      void addProcess(Process process)
      Method to add a process to the program
      mc.BDDModel buildModel() 
      net.sf.javabdd.BDD getBDD()
      Returns the BDD respresenting the program, it does not us any scheduling, thus any interleaving is posible the fairness issue must be deal with when model checking the properties, it only uses the scheduler to indicate which process was executed
      net.sf.javabdd.BDD getBDDwithScheduler()
      Returns the BDD representing the program, we use a simple scheduler: [1,..,1] one position for each process, one a process is executed we set the corresponding position to 0 and continue with the following one.
      net.sf.javabdd.BDD getInitialCond()
      Returns the initial states, get from the initial states of the processes needed by the model checker
      void initPrimes()
      Creates the primes for all the program, call init primes for processes (they create primes for local variables), creates primes for global variables, create primes for channels

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Program

        public Program(int intSize,
               int numberIntVars,
               int numberBoolVars,
               int numberBoolChannels,
               int numberIntChannels,
               int maxLengthChannels,
               mc.BDDModel model)
        Basic constructor for the class, it creates the required lists and a factory for the BDDs
        Parameters:
        inSize - the size of the integers
        numberIntVars - the number of int vars
        numberBoolVars - the number of Bool vars
        numberBoolChannels - the number of boolean channels
        numberIntChannels - the number of int channels
        maxLengthChannels - the maximum length of a channels in the program All the information given for the paramenters is used for creating the BDD's

        maxLengthChannels - the maximum length of a channels in the program All the information given for the paramenters is used for creating the BDD's

    • Method Detail

      • getInitialCond

        public net.sf.javabdd.BDD getInitialCond()
        Returns the initial states, get from the initial states of the processes needed by the model checker

      • getBDDwithScheduler

        public net.sf.javabdd.BDD getBDDwithScheduler()
        Returns the BDD representing the program, we use a simple scheduler: [1,..,1] one position for each process, one a process is executed we set the corresponding position to 0 and continue with the following one.

      • getBDD

        public net.sf.javabdd.BDD getBDD()
        Returns the BDD respresenting the program, it does not us any scheduling, thus any interleaving is posible the fairness issue must be deal with when model checking the properties, it only uses the scheduler to indicate which process was executed
